Reviews.Title: “A BEAUTIFUL, RELAXING HOTEL WITH FIRST-CLASS SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: RustyStar333
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: A newly-renovated DoubleTree done in soft earth-tones throughout (lobby and rooms). A medium-sized DoubleTree situated in the far end of a retail complex of restaurants and stores (Starbucks, Barnes & Noble, a very nice sports bar/restaurant, YogurtLand, Applebees, and more are all within a 5 minute walk from the hotel -- also Mimi's Cafe is just a little further down the road). It's a wonderful, convenient location. Also, the city trolley is right across the street and will take you to almost any place you would like to go in San Diego. Sea World and other tourist attractions are within a 10 minute drive. This hotel is in a very pretty section of town called Mission Valley - a retail area with palm trees everywhere and a very spacious and relaxed feel. SERVICE: We found the service to be excellent. We asked for a certain type of room and the front desk clerk not only got us the room we wanted, but told us to be sure and let her know if it was not up to our expectations. Another clerk called two restaurants for us to make sure they were still serving breakfast. Our car was brought up by valet within 5 minutes. Our bellman arrived within 3 minutes. We called the front desk to inquire about the internet services and we were given prompt, efficient information on how to connect. We were granted a late checkout time when we asked. The overall attitude was one of trying to help us in any possible way and we very much appreciated all the courtesies that were shown to us. ROOMS: The room exceeded our expectations. It was very spacious, newly decorated in earth-tones and had a great view of the pool and surrounding area (including the San Diego River, just across the way (which we never knew existed!). The flat-screen LG TV was large for a hotel (a 42" I think) with a perfect picture. Also, there was a very nice heavily padded lounge chair with matching ottoman to put your feet up and relax. The sliding glass door has a special opening and closing mechanism that allows it to be cracked open for fresh air to come into the room! It locks with a tight vacuum seal. The lighting in the room is done well..there are plenty of lights wherever you may need them. the bed was extremely comfortable with first-class linens. We slept well...at 6am when all was extremely quiet, we could hear the neighbors in the next room, but the sound was very, very low and muffled, and we felt the insulation between the rooms was top-notch. TECHNOLOGY: We liked how the hotel makes use of technology by having video monitors at the front desk that show you various informational slides about the hotel. You can learn a lot about the hotel from the video monitors. CLEANLINESS & DECOR: The hotel was extremely clean throughout. Beautiful, tall glass jars of orchids were on the entry table in the lobby. The lobbies on the floors also had green plants and sofas. There are elevators, of course, but there is also a lovely, wooden, interior stairway in the middle of the hotel which gives it a warm, homey feel. You can take those stairs to the second level and walk out onto the shopping plaza which is just outside the door. OUTDOOR RECREATION: There are two pools, both on the lobby level: The outdoor pool was large, bright and sparkling with plenty of places to sit and lots of palm trees. There were several fire pits with plenty of seating. There was also an indoor pool that was very large (for an indoor pool, which tend to be small). Also, a very nice fitness facility - again very clean. There are two tennis courts also, that look brand new. WILL WE RETURN? Overall, we really didn't want to leave and are very much looking forward to returning and recommending this property to our friends and family. It will be, after many years of looking, our "San Diego home" whenever we may find ourselves in this beautiful city. We have stayed in some of the best hotels in San Diego, but have always been disappointed in one way or another and never found one we would return to....until now! In summary; WE LOVED IT AND HOPE YOU WILL TOO! It's a little, hidden GEM of a hotel! :)

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: scottlove
Reviews.Content: The service upon entry was very good in that I given a nice welcome and smile but the hotel just did not measure up to other hotels that I often stay at in that it was not fresh and clean. Additionally, the breakfast buffet is limited in that there are not a lot of selections. It was not pleasant that you have to be asked for a breakfast coupon upon entry into the buffet area. I felt like a guard was stationed at the entry point to make certain that nobody gets away with eating w/o a coupon. Not one of my better stays and I probably will not return. I expect more from Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: siirena
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with comfortable accomodations and superb service. Right across from city trolley, made transportation easy to neighboring Mall and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Liars!!”
Reviews.Author: shepherd5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a complete Lie!!! On hotels.com it claims to be seconds from Sea World when in fact they are 20 miles north. DO NOT COME HERE. Shi**y hotel. Terrible location. Complete waste of time. Awful all around experience. I would never bring my family here ever again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good For Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: Moonface35
Reviews.Content: Traveled to San Diego for Business in March of 2011. Double Tree was a great hotel. Was upgraded to one of the executive floors. Room was great. Super comfortable bed. Internet was incredibly slow. Didn't eat at the hotel, except for what was served on the executive level for breakfast, but after 2 days, got kind of tired of the limited breakfast items, and just ended up grabbing something near my customer site. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Parking was in a garage attached to the hotel, and of course, parking was additional. COOKIES WERE DELICIOUS! The hotel is right next door to a multi-level type shopping mall, and very close to restaurants and other little shops. I would stay here again for business. If you are here for San Diego Sightseeing, it's a little out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “! Instead of remodeling the hotel they should do some remodeling of the staff!!! RUDE, RUDE, RUDE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marisa P
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Double Tree several times in San Diego over a few years with our two dogs. I always call to talk with a live person when booking ANY stay with our dogs so they can understand that the dogs will be accompanying us during the stay and to get dog rates as well. I did this when booking my stay in March 2012. Told the reservation specialist that we needed a king bed and that our two dogs would be staying with us in the room. When we arrived I checked in with the dogs at my side and we had gone through the lobby several times that day to visit the Ocean beach dog beach, get lunch and dinner. Mind you my dogs are Akitas and they around 100lbs each. Now these are large dogs, we always left through the main lobby; we stopped at the front desks to get cookies with our dogs and spent about 20 minutes talking with some of our country’s service members that wanted to pet our dogs and other guests that wanted to pet the pups in front of the check-in desk. All this was done in plain site of the staff members in the main lobby. Nothing was said about us having the dogs until the end the of the first day as my husband was taking the dogs on the last potty trip of the night; he was stopped by the a staff member that stated he was the manager and he asked if we were staying at the hotel and my husband said yes and we have stayed there several times before. The manager then informed my husband that we had to pay on extra 75 dollars because the hotel no longer allows animals to stay and if we didn’t pay this extra fee he would kick us out! We asked why nothing was said when we checked in or when we came through the lobby many times that day with our dogs and the manager said he didn’t know. We were shocked because of the steps we took to reserve the hotel and told the booking agent that we had dogs that were staying with us at the hotel. The manager accused us of trying to sneak our dogs in! I told this manager to look in the records and see that I called in the reservation because he did not believe that I did so, he stated that no one calls in reservations anymore they only make them online! He looked it up and the records stated that I called in the reservation! He was very rude and snippy! The customer service was terrible! The manager told us that he was going to catch heat from the CEO because our dogs were staying at the hotel. How is that our fault? We did everything right by stating that the dogs would be staying with us at the hotel! Plus this was the hotels booking mistake! NOT OURS!!! Because of the lack of communication by this manager we were harassed by security and the house keeping because we had the dogs and no one was informed that we were allowed to stay because it was the hotels booking agents fault! This made our stay very stressful! We will never stay at a Double Tree again! Instead of remodeling the hotel they should do some remodeling of the staff!!! RUDE, RUDE, RUDE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and great location”
Reviews.Author: MyDanesRock
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this hotel and we will be back again! The staff is very friendly, the best unlimited cookies, very clean rooms. We rented a car and easily drove around the city from this location. The only downside is $16/night parking; however, this is competitive for parking in the area. There is a nice pool and hot tub area with towels provided and good hours for use. The mall is a decent walking distance away too. The restaurant is very good food. Be warned the portions are huge! We could easily share the breakfast burrito.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful night clerk”
Reviews.Author: jruggerio
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel very early in the morning, around 1:30 if I remember correctly. The night clerk was very helpful in everything he did. The room I had was really nice and very spacious. It was a bummer I was only there for 8 hours or so. They had the signature DoubleTree cookie waiting on my bed as well as getting 2 at check-in. I did not have my HHonors waters in the room but he said I could substitute the $4/bottle waters instead. No time to visit the pool or eat breakfast. The lobby looked nice. The parking garage was easy to get around as well. I will stay at this hotel if I need to again.

Reviews.Title: “Great mini getaway, wonderful rooms and service!”
Reviews.Author: Scott H
Reviews.Content: Checked in sat afternoon with no problem, clerk at desk was extremely nice, and went the extra mile by making sure everything was good for my 8 month pregnant wife and I. The room was excellent, modern, clean and everything we could of asked for. Get the king deluxe with a balcony, one of the biggest rooms we have stayed in, everything remodeled! This hotel is near the mall, and theaters, so there is plenty to do without traveling too far. We will definitely stay here again next time we are in the Mission Valley/san Diego area, and will recommend the Doubletree to all our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay.....will return!!”
Reviews.Author: Treetop_67
Reviews.Content: I prefer to stay downtown in San Diego, but all the hotels I liked were booked so I tried this one in Mission Valley. It is actually the 4th hotel I have tried in Mission Valley (obviously the others did not leave enough of an impression to return) and next time I am in San Diego and need to stay in MV this will be my choice. The location of the Doubletree in MV is great because it is easy to get to the shopping areas or nearby places you would tend to go - liked that the trolley is just steps from the hotel and there were plenty of restaurants within walking distance if necessary. Mission Valley is centrally located if you want to do all that SD has to offer - it is just lacking in character which is why I like downtown. But we rarely spend time in our room and it is literally 5 minutes to Hillcrest, 10 minutes to the zoo and downtown, 10 minutes to the beaches and easy to navigate and never traffic....so you can't go wrong in that regard. I believe it was recently renovated and so everything is new and clean. I liked the style and decor of the room and it was actually spacious - more so than similar hotels in the area. The bed was super comfortable and the staff was professional, helpful and friendly. I definitely cringe at the parking fee and internet charge - but that is the standard in SD - so I have gotten used to it. The parking garage is attached and space was never an issue. I actually received an email with the option to upgrade to a business plan which gave me parking and internet for 70% less than if I paid the standard hotel rate - so that ended up being a bonus. The only odd thing that happened was the room did not come with a refrigerator so we had some food from a restaurant in a to go box from breakfast to have for snack later.....when we returned it was gone (assuming maid service tossed or ate it) but the empty wine bottles and paper grocery bags were still there. Is there a special way to communicate what is to not be thrown away? Usually if I do not want something I put it in the trash or next to it. These boxes were on the desk with other personal belongings. Not a big deal....just kind of weird. The only negative is that the bathroom walls did seem thin - could hear the people in the next room - but not their voices. Mostly just the plumbing noises....but they were suprisingly loud at times. The sliding bathroom door is a nice feature decoratively speaking - but not really functional as far as privacy - but those were both things that as a guest did not bother me, but could others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Boulder-USA
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at this hotel at the last minute and were pleasantly surprised by the quality and value. Service at the front desk and restaurants was excellent. The rooms were quite good and the location, while not central San Diego, was easy to maneuver from.

Reviews.Title: “YUMMY Cookies”
Reviews.Author: FemmeFrancaise
Reviews.Content: I thought it had excellent customer service, front desk, housekeeping were excellent. Excellent location. It was close to restaurants and shops, and there was also access to the whole city on the trolley, which was right across the street!!! YUMMY Cookies.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Convenient... Free Parking + Free Wifi available”
Reviews.Author: stuntgal
Reviews.Content: Got to stay at this nice hotel through Priceline (3 stars). Was at first shocked that I had to tag on $16/day for parking and more for Wifi access in the room! Fortunately, there was plenty of free street parking just outside the hotel and free wifi access was available at the lobby, for those needing to keep a budget. Starbucks is at shopping center right beside hotel, within walking distance, as is Barnes & Noble and a few restaurants and UltraStar Theater. The SD Trolley station is just across the street so easy to get around SD and downtown from here. Front desk service was good - Claude was exceptionally helpful in getting me connected online when I had a problem. Bathroom pipes were noisy and squeaked when another unit was using water. Our room was 807. Bathroom was spacious, room was clean & AC comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: pinkins
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. Very convenient to both Mission Valley and Fashion Valley malls as well as Qualcomm stadium, and there is ample street parking at no cost. The hotel has been recently renovated making the rooms very comfortable, eye-pleasing, and enjoyable. Seth is the consummate professional; courteous and willing to assist you in any way possible. No matter how often I bothered Seth with my requests, he patiently fulfilled each one of them making me feel like a very welcome guest:) The swimming pools and Jacuzzi are nice; although we did need to hunt someone down to replenish the towels. Overall, this is a very nice and comfortable hotel at an affordable price. Oh yes! The cookies are amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Best HomeStyle Doubletree Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Bessdressed
Reviews.Content: Amazing crew that makes you feel right at home- literally. They made every detail of our trip pleasant and truly one to remember! Our favorite was Claude, he remembered my husband and I by name, and never missed a chance to say "Hi, how are you guys doing?". Also Maria and Kurt were pleasant and accommodating as well with smiling faces! :) As we stayed an entire week, they were nice enough to provide us with a fridge and microwave- which was definitely an added bonus for nights we just couldn't finish our dinner and wanted a snack for the next day! It made a difference in which hotel we will choose next time in SD :) The amenities are amazing with an updated gym (LOVE the new treadmills!!). Also unlike most hotels, this one offers two pools, one indoors and one outdoors! The location is dead smack center of EVERYTHING! Food, shopping, downtown etc! Not to mention the train stops directly in front of the hotel itself! Love that it is located on a dead end street with very few traffic. As a Diamond member however, wish thay a full breakfast was included as an upgrade in the restaurant on the weekends. (BTW Robyn who works in the executive lounge and breakfast was so sweet, she gave us plenty of tips while in the city!) Please recognize the people mentioned above, as customer service is not dead! For my husband and I, it makes a world of a difference! Thank you for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel stay in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: AZGUY99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on my visit to San Diego. Quiet and clean room, great food in the bar and restaurant. Service was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for wedding destination hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kathyodhome
Reviews.Content: Everyone I spoke to was excited about your hotel as a place to have everyone stay for our destination wedding. The rooms were large and comfortable and many used the the gym, hot tub, the bar etc. It's close proximity to many stores, restaurants, and the local trolley. The big plus was your staff at the desk(s) who were always there with a smile and helpful information. The cookies were a special treat and when I had trouble printing something your staff ensured my success. The breakfasts with omelet bar added to our morning pleasure and using the Brickstone Room for a group buffet breakfast the day after the wedding was a real plus. You were more than accommodating in the planning and execution of our five day stay for my daughter's wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Good to stay”
Reviews.Author: Machilus
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because my friend was a HHonor Gold member, and I am too. The room price was fairly good and the location was not far away too. Generally speaking, it was a good hotel with beautiful scenery and convenient location. They didn't provide the airport shuttle service unitl Mar.12th according to hotel tele-operator. Upon arrival, my friend was upgraded to a higher level with balcony as a benefit of gold member. He also told me the front desk representative who was learning Chinese, was very helpful and humorous. The room was good but no refrigerator in which caused a trouble that we had no cool place to put our take-out. The internet was 11.95/per day which was expensive and we wanted to use our Gold member account to login but failed. We had to choose bill to my room option but finally the hotel waived this. We visited 2 of the lounges in this hotel, the window and the fountain. both of them were pretty good. The window lounge is a good place to relax. The hotel provided self parking which charges 16 per day. One might find one outside the hotel at less cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property....excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Luv2cruisemore
Reviews.Content: We hosted our son and daughter-in-law's destination wedding in San Diego last weekend. The wedding was in Balboa Park and we needed a local hotel that could accommodate our many out-of-town guests. Our family and friends ended up reserving 113 room nights. The hotel staff could not have been more accommodating. Special kudos to our contact, Spencer Priest and the front desk manager, Kirk. Our price included breakfast so they provided a special room (with a private buffet) for us the morning after the wedding for around 100 guests, for no extra charge. We were able to share another meal with our departing guests in a private room. The hotel has and indoor/outdoor pool and a fitness center with up-to-date machines. The lobby had plenty of space for us to meet and chat with our guests. The location was excellent, right off the 163, close to everything. An upscale strip mall is attached which had a great Sports Bar where many of our guests had some meals. The mall also had nail and hair salons for our bridal party. The hotel has been redone, so you feel like you're in an upscale 4 or 5-star hotel, but at 3-star prices. The rooms are decorated in warm, contemporary decor and the beds are very comfortable. There are pictures on their website. Of course, don't forget about the unlimited warm chocolate chip cookies!

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: pittipatga
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights during a convention. We live a 5 hour flight away and e-mailed prior to visiting to assure that our accommodations would be comfortable. We booked a room on the executive level, are Hilton Honors members, and hoped prior communication with the Hilton would guarantee a pleasant trip. We were given room 1114-must be the worst room in the hotel. Our email specifically ask/requested/inquirred a room with a balcony. We were told that there were beautiful balconies with spectacular views. We had a concrete slab about 2 feet wide with NO furniture or roof overlooking a gravel covered air conditioner rooftop with a view of a noisy freeway that was horrible. We went back to the front desk requesting a change of rooms but was told all they could do was move us across the hall to view the other side of the freeway. This room was at a 90 degree angle to a hallway with windows that looked directly into the room. Horrible botht inside and out. One night we came back to our room to find a nice set up of wine and cheese and snacks-had they decided to apologize for their rude treatment-no-there was a card addressed to another quest-surprise-they delivered it to the wrong room. When we called to tell them about the mistake-more of the same-we will come get it. No apology. Hilton-you can now keep your little cookies-we will go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and good hotel, with good location”
Reviews.Author: MikeN76
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is a relative modern building, with a very large entry hall, and large nice clean rooms. Rooms have a nice bathroom and a large flatscreen tv. Breakfast is available in the hotel (either included in your room price, or either you can order a la carte), as well as dinner. The hotel has a fitness room, outdoor pool and indoor pool, which you can all use for free! In other words: you get quality at this hotel. The location is in my opinion quite good. Although the hotel is not located in the downtown area (it is located at the end of a dead-end street, with a shopping area just nearby), it is perfectly located to reach all interesting destinations. The reason for this is the Trolley station that is just across the street! The San Diego Trolley (green line here) can bring you to downtown in a short time, and also leads to numerous other places (even to the border with Mexico) and attractions. The Trolley is very convenient, runs every 15 minutes, and day pass is only 5 dollars (you can buy them from machines in every station). To summarize: a good hotel, and because of the trolley nearby also in a perfect location. Interesting tip: the hotel has a shuttle service to the airport, which runs every hour (on the hour). It's only 10 dollars for a ride, which is cheaper than a taxi ride to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a meeting”
Reviews.Author: echolaine
Reviews.Content: I was the guest speaker at a meeting recently at this hotel. The meeting staff was very available, the front desk personnel were very helpful, and the ice water never ran out. We had to add extra chairs as more guests showed up than we would have expected and it was done quickly and happily. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice; very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: arf68
Reviews.Content: I recently spent three nights at this hotel while attending a conference that was held there--otherwise I wouldn't have chosen to stay there, but convenience won out. I was quite pleased with my choice as the room I had on the 10th floor was spacious and well appointed and I found the location to be quite convenient. As I only had short breaks from the conference I appreciated the opportunity to nip out in my rental car to nearby grocery stores and other shopping (lots nearby), as well as to the shops and restaurants in the adjacent Hazard Center. I also used the trolley stop that is right across the street to go to Old Town, so transit connections are good from there. With a car, the location is very good as there is easy access to most of where one would need to go in the city. The biggest plus for me is the level of staff friendliness and helpfulness. The fact of the matter is that when one has many options for fairly similar types of hotels, a repeat visit will come down to whether or not one has been treated nicely by the staff. If they show that they care that I am giving them my custom then it is more than likely that I'll be back. One negative is that they charge $16 per night for parking in their parkade. This seems to be standard for hotels in the area, but it doesn't mean I have to like it. I noticed that some people parked on the street out front, which looked reasonably secure to me. Wi Fi was $11 per day, which I didn't like paying either, but it worked really really well so that was good. Free or cheap Wi Fi is useless if it doesn't work well, so at least I know I was getting good use for my dollar. Web page load speeds were fast and I was able to Face Time with no glitches whatsoever. That's about all I ask for. I've given this hotel five stars based on a comparison with other similar hotels I've stayed in the last 12 months. A nice room and great staff made this a superior experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suburban Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ATLBob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty convenient if you're attending a football game or doing business nearby: it's close to 163, the 5 and the 8, is a very short drive to UCSD and is next-door to a shopping mall and some national chain restaurants, and right down the street from Qualcomm Stadium. The DoubleTree is only 15 minutes from the airport rental car site, so it's an easy option for those needing to work in downtown as well. Our room was large enough for two, it had adequate closet space and dresser/storage space for two, and the king sized bed was comfortable. The only small qualm is that there isn't much counter space around the bathroom sink to accommodate two people. Instead, I used one of the two shelves that held the clean towels and shampoo/conditioner (consolidated them into one shelf) and my wife took the entire space around the sink for her stuff, so it worked out OK. Rooms have a medium sized flat screen LG HD TV, a couple of HBO channels and the usual variety of HD local/national stations as well. The hotel area was always clean, the indoor and outdoor pools were spotless and the exercise facility seemed adequate. There is ample parking, but it's not free--the good news is that your room key gets you into/out of the garage so it's easy to come and go at will. We found the staff in the lobby/desk were all very helpful and pleasant to deal with in terms of directions and suggestions. The three elevators worked fairly quickly so there wasn't a lot of waiting around. Our room was booked to include the buffet breakfast, which was OK. There were scrambled eggs, breakfast potatoes, bacon/sausage, various pastries, yogurt, breads, cereals, etc., but nothing really outstanding or bad. They would also prepare eggs to order or prepare an omelet as part of the buffet offering. There is a fairly large bar/TV area that seemed to get a fair amount of traffic each night, and there was another restaurant that we did not try during our stay. The best overall food item IMHO is the wonderful DoubleTree chocolate-chip cookies that are generously available! Tons of calories AND flavor....and they are simply wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice room”
Reviews.Author: Linda35394
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the location and its proximity to the football stadium for a SDSU football game. There were restaurants nearby; two coffee shops, including Starbucks; a bookstore; and the trolley, which we rode to and from the game. Massage Envy was also next door, so I even got a massage, although I believe they have spa services at the hotel as well. It was fantastic! We had dinner and drinks in the hotel bar, which was also nice; there is a great fitness room and pool area; two large firepits; and a jacuzzi. All in all, our stay was better than expected. Staff was cordial and friendly. Could not have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Walking16
Reviews.Content: Good sized rooms. Excellent service. Close to restaurants and shopping with easy access to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KOinDenver
Reviews.Content: Very nice property and will stay again - parking garage fee - staff was professional and friendly. Cookie was yummy. Great sleep in comfortable bed. Nice flat TV with HD service in the box. Plenty of storage for your things if you like to unpack. Room service was good too!

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: postcardsfrompeta
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as it was close to the zoo and sea world. Joe's Crab Shack is within the shopping complex which was great! Rooms were very spacious, close to train station.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Spacious Rooms. Friendly Staff. Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: Banshee123
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered everything we wanted; clean and spacious rooms, very helpful staff and perfect central location in San Diego. It's also very close to a lot of great restaurants and Fashion Valley Mall. The hotel is also very close to the light rail station to take the train to Old Town or Downtown. We stayed here two nights in January and the always felt welcome. As a HHonors member, this hotel provided excellent delivery of the HHonors benefits, including breakfast for all in the room, internet, water and of course fabulous cookies. Would certainly stay here again as it meets the Hilton standard for hotel quality.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant & clean”
Reviews.Author: traipsingguru
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August when it was warm and sunny every single day. It must be the just-baked looking/smelling cookies (one per person) they give you once you're checked in that entices people to stay here. Rates are pricey but the amenities are all there. Restaurant serves good breakfast, indoor lounging areas were large enough and welcoming enough. Outdoor pool is clean and welcoming, indoor pool is tiny (good enough for three I'd say). There is a bridge on the second floor that connects you to the outside shopping mall area. They don't tell you this but you can explore the hotel.... that's how we found it. Lots of inexpensive places to eat outside of the hotel if you are willing to walk a couple of blocks (may be worth it if you don't want to pay for the expensive hotel restaurant food). There was also a nice trail that we did one morning. It's an urban greenbelt, of course, but it's a nice walk in the morning before things get hot and dry. It's a haven for conferences in the summer but many brought their families. Internet is not free! You'd think for the amount you pay per night that internet access would just be part of that. The train stop that takes you to old town stops right across the street from the front of the hotel. If you plan to stay longer than two days, I recommend purchasing a multi-day pass if you plan to visit old town each one of those days.

Reviews.Title: “The Friendliest Hotel We've Ever Used”
Reviews.Author: SRL1975
Reviews.Content: I've never been welcomed at a hotel as wonderfully as this! Every single staff member we met was friendly, looked you in the eye with a giant "Hello!" and asked if we needed anything! One morning, my husband & I decided to take a walk and were standing outside at the curb to decide which way to go when the Bellman came up behind us with a suggestion. (It was a great idea too!). No one saw the lengths he took to advise us; he just applied what all the employees at this hotel were instructed to do and did it with personality. Same thing happened with the bartender and the waitress and the concierge.....you can be sure we'll stay there again. This attitude seemed to affect in the guests of the hotel as well. Everyone said hello to everyone else; it seems good nature can spread after all. I did mention in the Manager's Request Card that it could be the cookies.... This is besides the fact that it is quiet, clean, the restaurant is delicious and well staffed and you can't beat the cookies.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Great staff, good location, great amenities and rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravellingAussies_11
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 3 nights in early December as part of our USA vacation from Australia and had an excellent experience. The staff were welcoming and friendly, the room was a good size and The parking next door was easy and convenient. We loved the heated outdoor spa and pool - even in winter. The hotel is in a good central location to San Diego sites provided you have a vehicle and a GPS ! Very close to Fashion Valley mall. The on-site little store was also very handy. Would fully recommend this to all travellers and vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “One issue keeps this from being a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Viking94708
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Christmas weekend to relax, see SD and visit friends. Everything is great here including a heated outdoor swimming pool in winter. I remember this hotel was built as a Red Lion Inn 20 years ago when Red Lion was building nearly 4-star hotels. Then Hilton Bought Doubletree and Red Lion and it's still a standout Doubletree property. My only issue was the Wi-Fi in the room. I was on the top floor all the way at the far end, and I suspect that had something to do with it. I NEVER had anything other than 1 or 2 bars on the wireless. At least once an hour, I would loose the signal completely. I notified the front desk and they seemed oblivious about the problem. I tried the wireless in the lobby and the signal was excellent. If I had to pay for wireless, I would have pitched a major fit, but what are you going to do when you don't have to pay for it? I'd come back again, but be more wary of room location.

Reviews.Title: “Super staff, nice rooms, very good location”
Reviews.Author: Laterisers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights in December, we arrived at this Doubletree by mistake, traffic on I-5 had been terrible from L.A. the people greating us at the front desk were incredable, first giving us directions to our original hotel, then on our request finding a room for us here, it turns out to be a very good mistake on our part as we are looking forward to returning and definately plan on staying at this property. There are restaurants and fast food next door within easy walking distance, a few shops and a movie theater. Also fairly close is a mall with the usual (Macys, Nordstroms, etc...). It is very easy to access I-5 and other interstates for travel and the trolley is right across the street with access to downtown and other areas. We felt very safe in the area and everyone at the Doubletree was very friendly. We felt we received very good service, above average quality room for the price we paid and as stated above, look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Good For Extended Stays”
Reviews.Author: ZhenZhu888
Reviews.Content: I stayed for over 2 weeks while on business. There are special offers, like reduced priced parking and free internet, through the doubletree website if you are booking for extended stays. The rooms are spacious and recently renovated. The staff is very friendly and helpful. If you are willing to spend a little extra, it could be worth upgrading your room to the executive level that includes a small free breakfast and afternoon/evening snack everyday (vouchers for their regular breakfast and bar on the weekends). The location is good for Mission Valley. There is a shopping complex with a movie theater and a few restaurants next door, a grocery store a block or two away, and it is literally across the street from the trolley that is one stop away to two major shopping destinations and can take you downtown or to charger stadium. It is also very easy to drive downtown or out to the beach if you have a car. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to a friend and will definitely try to stay here if I find myself in the San Diego area again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Renovation!”
Reviews.Author: Babycakesk
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stay here often as we are Charger Season ticket holders. Its the perfect location to hop onto the trolley & head to the game. The Valet is exceptional & the rooms are beautifully renovated in clean modern lines. My only complaint is on our last stay housekeeping forgot to clean our room. :(

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Just_Traveler
Reviews.Content: The Double Tree Mission Valley in San Diego is a really good option if you want to go and do some shopping ( it is located between two big shopping malls). Hotel is really nice, just remodeled all rooms and they are comfy, and great. Food is good but not spectacular. The bar area is really nice and you can sit in front of outside fireplaces and have a drink. Staff is really nice and helpfull. Of course the signature cookie is always a great upside !

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location - free parking on street - comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: jennkk
Reviews.Content: First time travellers to San Diego and this hotel was a GREAT FIND! We were tempted to stay downtown, but the prices just didn't justify what a 10 minute care ride would accommodate. If you have your own car, or plan on using the city's transport - I highly recommend saving the bucks and staying in the 'Hotel Circle- Mission Valley' as it is still VERY accessible to any major tourist spots (I dont we ever drove more than 15 minutes to Zoo, Gaslamp District, Coronado Island, etc) and quieter at nights, and right off freeways. Rooms are clean, beds/linens very comfortable. Only drawback in rooms are that they are not equipped with a fridge - there is a 'reasonable'' 20 dollar fee for the duration of your trip if a fridge is needed. Otherwise bright, spacious, modern bathrooms on our floor (6th) Very attentive staff in dining/lounge/bar area. And Starbucks right in hotel - convenient. This hotel backs up against a dead end street - which means Free Parking - which saves you a nice bundle if your stay is more than a night with a car (we stayed 4 Nights - enough space to park on street every night)

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HomerNottingham
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel indeed, staff are very friendly and can't do enough to help you. Rooms are huge and plenty of space. Comfy beds. Breakfast was excellent and service perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Kate O
Reviews.Content: Lovely, cozy hotel. Very friendly staff. It is a drive away from all parts of the city, but seemed decently centered as most of Cali cities are spread out. Seemed like everything was a 20 minute drive which worked well for us. The Zoo, the beaches, downtown, it just worked out great for us. Staff was so accommodating and helpful. Great hotel, if you plan on using a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer rooms, but the service has gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: CyrusMoo
Reviews.Content: I attend a conference at this hotel every other year and have seen the evolution of the hotel over the past 6 years. What used to be a hotel with great service, but inadequate and uncomfortable rooms has become a hotel with really nice rooms, and declining customer service. On my most recent visit, I was assigned to a Hilton Honors floor. Everything was updated and in excellent working order. Very comfortable. My only complaint about the room was the cost of good wireless internet service -- nearly $15! On the service side, however, it was quite lacking. Staff were not able to provide helpful suggestions and weren't very responsive to questions. Despite having their famous chocolate chip cookies, they weren't giving them to everyone. I'd also note that the coffee shop has very limited hours. Also, in the business center, it costs $1 to print one page. The fees are very excessive. This area of San Diego has declined significantly in the past couple of years. Many of the restaurants in the adjoining mall have closed, so if you are looking for a quick dinner, there aren't many options. One thing to consider if you have time is taking the light rail to the Old Town area. Some excellent restaurants to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for Quick Weekend Trip”
Reviews.Author: djkara
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here the first weekend of October for a quick trip to Sea World. As other reviewers have stated, it may seem located out of the way but the trolley stops pretty much directly in front of the hotel. Found street parking both nights so didn't have to pay for parking. We were greeted nicely at check-in with and were provided with two warm cookies. Since I am a Hilton Honors member we had a room on the Honors floor, which I don't know if that actually changes anything other then having a higher location. Room was very clean, spacious, and modern. Bed was very comfortable, and we came back both nights to another cookie waiting for us. Would definitely stay here again. Only downside was outdoor pool/spa area were under repair during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “All good: From the warm reception to the warm cookies”
Reviews.Author: SFO_Drew
Reviews.Content: On a map, the location might seem a bit out of the way of typical tourist sights. But if you have a car, it is actually quite central and convenient. I found free street parking fairly easily (but wish the hotel did not charge for parking). If you do not have a car, the trolley stops right across the street. More on the plus side, the staff was incredibly friendly. The room was clean and modern and quite comfy. The room is well-suited for business (reading chair, nice desk, pay wi-fi). Plenty of quick food choices within walking distance. NOTE: The windows have a unique feature to allow ventilation without being opened. But if they are not latched properly, you may hear street noise. Once closed, however, the room was perfectly silent.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Hot”
Reviews.Author: taranm
Reviews.Content: we were off to a nice start, loved the warm cookies that we received upon checking in and loved the Starbucks in the lobby of this hotel. Unfortunately, thats about all of the pleasant things I can say about our stay at this hotel. When we got to our room, the in-room safe was closed and locked, so we put in a call to the front lobby to have someone come and open it for us...that never happened. Upon waking up the next morning and going into the bathroom, I was greeted by a nice puddle of water that had pooled around the perimeter of our toilet, this was never fixed either. House keeping never made our bed, beu rather pulled up the covers around the sheets to make it look as though the bed had been made. Our complimentry toiletries and towels were not replenished daily as part of the daily cleaning/ maid service. For almost $200/ night I would have expected better. I was seriously disappointed and will not be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlfor
Reviews.Content: My first time there was this week. Redesigned rooms are very attractive, lobby is pretty, location is good, trolley stop makes it very convenient to Old Town, lots of shopping and eating options (albeit mostly chains) are in walking distance. Complaints are food quality is poor for breakfast, room didn't feel super clean, and they need an earlier shuttle than 6am on a Friday (all us East Coasters have flights leaving about then). My three colleagues all shared my problem of getting the thermostats to hold a steady temp in the rooms. I won't rush back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Richard195418
Reviews.Content: Lovely stay at Easter. Great location on trolley route and very easy trip into San Diego and Old Town. Loved the cookies and will definately stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Totally wonderful experience!!! They treat their Hilton Honors members with class.”
Reviews.Author: kskkjohns
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here while my husband had work. It was rainy and gloomy outside, so we weren't looking for a hotel by the beach. This location was perfect for us, as we could walk next door to the movie theater, Starbucks and Applebees. My husband is a Diamond Platinum HH member. Since the hotel wasn't very busy (mostly business travelers), they upgraded us to the Presidential Suite, for a minimal cost. Such a treat!!! We added a roll away bed to the King room and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The chocolate chip cookies at check- in are always a delight. The staff was warm and attentive. Anytime my husband has work in SD, we will definitely be back. He comes here often and I can see why!!

Reviews.Title: “We were robbed! And management couldn't care less.”
Reviews.Author: Allen S
Reviews.Content: After a full day at Sea World, we returned to our room, and our son noticed that his clothes was all over the floor, and the bag was missing. We thought at first that this was his own doing, however a search of the room did not turn up the bag. Odd.... Then we started getting concerned. Sure enough, our LAPTOP (inside a suitcase in the closet) had been stolen! The bad guys apparently got in, found the laptop, emptied my son's bag and used that to take the laptop away. Nothing else was stolen. We notified management and called police. Management's response was basically, "gee, sorry." Security did send up someone to read the cardkey reader, however for some strange reason, they couldn't access the server. They essentially blamed us for not putting the laptop in the safe (like anyone puts their laptop in the safe...they don't fit in most places anyway). We asked for some sort of bag in which to re-pack our son's clothes, but they couldn't even be bothered with that, and in fact, derisively told us that they couldn't just give luggage away. We weren't asking for luggage. We ended up packing him in a few laundry bags. Their insurance denied our claim (no surprise there), but no one ever explained how it was possible that anyone got into our room that day. Hilton corporate wasn't helpful, either.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: RamDynasty
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for 4 nights and it was very nice. The room was large and had comfy bed and flat screen tv. I dont think it had an inroom refrigerator though. In room wireless was an additional $12 per night. Self parking was additional $16 per night. Did get a free USA today each day. Randy Jones sports bar and Joes Crab Shack are just outside the side entrance of the Doubletree. The location was central to where we needed to be and everything was clean. The front desk people were nice and made 5 photocopies of some documents for me. Much appreciated. The pool was drained and I never got to use it, but it looked like it would be nice, the one day I went down to use it. This is a nice place but my complaints were that wireless should be free for the price paid to stay there and they didnt have a complimentary airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jean O
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this particular hotel several times and will continue to do so. It is my hotel of choice when coming to San Diego. It is very central to everything. It is clean and the staff are receptive and helpful and they have been on each of my visits. They have recently refreshed the rooms and they look very trendy and nice. With the new doors on the balconies, you hear absolutely no street noise bleeding through when the door is closed. Extremely well insulated. A little difficult to maneuver at first because you can crack the door for fresh air without opening it all the way, but it is a neat added feature.

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean and Super Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jindia
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting much but I was pleasantly surprised when we pulled up to the hotel. The exterior is inviting and feels more like an island resort than a hotel off the freeway. It felt inviting. Then, it was easy to park the car, check in and get to our room quickly. The room itself was lovely. All new contemporary decor, spacious, and clean. There was a balcony too! I was excited to open the sliding door to the balcony and stand outside for some fresh air. Sadly, the noise from the freeway was so loud that I couldn't keep the door open for long. That was the only drawback to this hotel that I found. There was a beautiful pool that we could see from our balcony but if the noise was terrible up on my balcony it must also be significant down at the pool. Still, with the hotel right on I-8 and near the junction of I-5 its easy to get to all points in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, BAD service”
Reviews.Author: rmarquez99
Reviews.Content: I begin by stating that the minute we walked into the lobby I told the receptionist that I we had to be at a dinner whom reservations we might loose if we weren't in and out of the hotel within an hour. This would be an extraordinary feat considering we were driving to downtown San Diego from the hotel which is about 5 miles away and we were not dressed for the occasion. The somewhat friendly receptionist smiled and stated that there were no room ready for us to be able to change in. The next available room would be in about 45 mins. To make things worse after 20 mins of back and forth of room guarantee's and the fact that they wanted us to desperately get a double bed we misunderstood him that he had a king available. So as he was handing the keys to us, I realized he had just mentioned that the room was 2 queen beds. I proceeded to give him the keys back and told him that if my now canceled reservation would charge me for not showing up to the dinner reservation then I will proceed to get his name and the name of his supervisor so that I can call corporate and file a complaint. The supervisor whom was right next to him told him that there were rooms available and proceeded to open a block of rooms whom had been available from the start. My head by that point was close to the boiling point for which I proceeded to just get the keys, run upstairs, get dressed and get to my dinner an hour 45 minutes late. This has to be the most incompetent hotel staff that I have ever encountered! I will make it a point to never stay at that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Paid extra for a king, no kings available”
Reviews.Author: Russell09
Reviews.Content: After a long day at Legoland and downtown San Diego, we drove 20 minutes to get here. It was 10 pm and we couldn't wait to get to bed. Because it was just my wife and I with our two year old, we had previously paid close to 20 dollars more to ensure a king sized bed. With the two of us to surround our son, he would have a smaller chance of rolling off the bed in the middle of the night. When we got to our room however, we found two separate full sized beds. A call to the front desk yielded a kind and understanding gentleman that could not find us any rooms with a king with it. He did take our parking fee off the bill, but that should not have been there in the first place. It's not like the hotel was in a high demand area. The bottom line is: if a hotel is going to accept a reservation for a king sized bed at a higher price, then that hotel must offer more than simply the cost differential back when the originally reserved room is not available. An upgrade to s suite and or free access to the wifi would have been a more reasonable gesture for this inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: ametrinel
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's and my 25th anniversary. The rooms were large and well arranged. Each night we sat out by the fire pit and enjoyed the cool weather with a nice cup of coffee. Next time I'm in San Diego, I will definitely stay here! I was a bit upset when we got there to check in around 6pm because our room wasn't ready. We needed to change to go for our anniversary dinner and we didn't have a room to do that in. Other than a late room, it was a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star hotel at a 3 star Price!”
Reviews.Author: AccentdESIGN
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Remodel - Rooms are spacious, nice TV with HD channels, comfy beds, very very friendly staff! Great location - less than 10 minutes away from everything in San Diego FYI Parking is like $16 per night HOWEVER plenty of free parking on the street in front of the hotel. We stayed 4 nights and the spots are closer than the parking garage haha! Only downside is this doubletree charges to use the internet in the busines center ...love this hotel recommend for couples or business travelors Booked for under $100 on priceline too =)

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Hotel. Will come back definitely”
Reviews.Author: anoop n
Reviews.Content: Good Clean hotel. Large rooms, 2 heated pools (indoor and outdoor), on site restaurants and lots of restaurants and Cinemas close by. Great location. Little on the pricey side, but will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - Will definately stay again when in the San Diego area!”
Reviews.Author: SLC1622
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Very convenient location. We utilized the trolley that is right across the street and it was so easy to get around. Hotel staff is courteous and friendly. Overall - a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: GlobalGirlz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here or one night. Room felt recently renovated. Bathroom was clean and nice and bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Average but totally ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: arne500
Reviews.Content: An average hotel with good and helpful staff. Little boring location but also ok. Fitness rom was pretty good. Food was good.

Reviews.Title: “excellent all around stay- no problems, close to lots of restaurants”
Reviews.Author: hawksfansince1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and it was excellent, both the staff and the physical property were great and everything went smooth and perfect. No problems whatsover. The front desk staff was helpful and fast, everything in room worked and the room itself was clean.A minor picky thing about the shower is you cannot reach ANY towel from the shower itself, you have to walk out to get the towels where they are at so be careful on the bathroom floor.The pools are great and gym is well equipped (but missing leg extension and a few pieces) and you have to walk through the inside pool area getting your gym shoes wet from the pool deck to go to the gym. It is walking distance five minutes or less to two grocery stores, Jack In The Box, Carl Jr's, a Japanese fast food restaurant, 2 mexican restaurants, a yogurt place, a big bookstore, good sportsbar restaurant,Starbucks, a cafe with good breakfast, Joes Crab Shack, Applebees and Dennys, a few other things as well Internet is fast in business room in lobby.Trolley right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Unless your company is paying beware the added fees”
Reviews.Author: Parrot111
Reviews.Content: $19 to park, $13.55 to use WiFi, $19.95 per person for breakfast unless you go the cold cereal and juice route, that's only $11.00 per person plus tax and tip. The certainly don't price this place like it's an older chain hotel hanging over the expressway but that's all it is. Comfortable beds, clean but other than that just like every chain hotel in the world. The difference here is your $140 dollar room becomes about $260.00 if you park, use WiFi and eat breakfast there. We called the hotel to book, we were told they had WiFi and breakfast but made it sound as if it was included. The $19.00 parking wasn't mentioned until we pulled up. We got in very late and were stuck here.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Shopping, Restaurants & Freeways”
Reviews.Author: WldHrt60
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of the Comic Con package. Breakfast was included in the room price. The rooms were recently renovated. Staff was very helpful. Convenient location for shopping, dining and getting around San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “I called the hotel directly, by-passed Hotels.com and they waived the per person room charge. Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Girls-a-cruzin
Reviews.Content: Newly Remodeled. Super clean and spiffy. Nice pool and pit fires at night to sit around. Warm cookies when you check in. Great location to down town, mission valley...beware of the parking fees. $15 a night...OUCH!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jill09
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for one night. It is about 5 to 10 minute drive to SeaWorld. I am a gold hilton honors member and upon check in we received a coupon for two appetizers and two non alcholic drinks in lieu of the executive club which is not open on weekends. Also we got a free continental breakfast. We were on the 10th floor (Hilton Honors floor)the room faced the strip mall so we didn't hear any noise at all. Wi Fi was free due to our hilton honors status. The room was renovated with a comfy bed, nice flat screen and a small chair and ottoman. Parking was a little on the high side $19 for valet, $14 or $15 for self park. They did have one of their elevators out of service so we had to wait a few minutes longer than it normally should have taken. I would stay here again. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Front Desk Staff and Windows Lounge Were Great”
Reviews.Author: PhillyNee
Reviews.Content: We recently booked several rooms at the Doubletree Hotel San Diego Mission Valley. As a Hilton Gold Card member, I had excellent perks, but the entire group had a great stay. The rooms were excellent, the front desk was very helpful and accommodating to our group and we all gathered during the late evenings in the Windows lounge - the appetizers were really good for sharing and the service in the Windows Lounge was absolutely outstanding. We stayed for hours in this very comfortable setting and the waitresses were responsive, unintrusive and made us feel welcome. This location is convenient to highways and to downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the Con, but still comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Slobass
Reviews.Content: I booked my SDCC travel late and got this hotel with the convention rate. I ended up on the 9th floor and had a really spacious room. It would have been nice if it had a refrigerator, but I was able to eat out at the nearby restaurants enough that it didn't really matter. Comfy bed and prompt service was a plus. The cookie was a treat! My only real complaint would be with their "high speed" internet... as it was not what anyone would consider high speed in 2011 (maybe in 1998). The breakfast buffet was okay, not a lot of options, but ordering off the menu produced a really tasty start to the day. Not a bad hotel if you're staying in SD, but it was okay for SDCC (the close proximity to the trolley was a definite plus).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ooonor
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many many times, for lots of reasons. First, the staff. From the front desk staff to the people who work in the restaurant, I feel liked and welcome. Second, the convenience. Of the hotels in mission valley, this is quite easy to get in and out of, and I can always find a parking space (and almost always I find free street parking and don't have to pay for it - sorry about that, Hilton). Third, the price. Often when I can't find other hotels that are affordable, this hotel miraculously, at least using the Hilton web site, will have a room I feel comfortable booking. Last time I stayed there, the executive lounge was closed at night, and I was given a gift certificate for the restaurant. If you CAN get this lucky, you are in for a treat. If you don't, you might consider going to the restaurant anyway. I have made the mistake in the past of simply filling myself up in the lounge on free appetizers, but the restaurant food is quite good for a hotel. Rooms are comfortable, and upgraded recently to a nice decor that I guess I'd call "island". Finally as with all doubletree hotels, the cookies are dangerously good. If you want to fit in your clothes tomorrow, don't even open the door when the turn-down service shows up with MORE cookies!

Reviews.Title: “Our hotel of choice for Comic-Con”
Reviews.Author: Det_Films
Reviews.Content: This is where we always choose to stay during ComicCon -- it may be in Mission Valley but the shuttle is fast and the hotel is much nicer than you can get elsewhere for the price. ComicCon is a huge convention and generally puts a strain on all San Diego facilities, but the DoubleTree handles it well. Even when there was a glitch -- for instance, the computer that made room key-cards went down just as we arrived -- the desk clerk (named Elvira -- management take note; she is commendable) promptly and cheerfully took over by checking us in by hand, sending someone to let us into our room, and had our key cards and some free perks waiting for us by the time we returned from our first foray to the Con. Problems happen at any hotel -- it is how they are handled that really makes the difference, and this was handled well. The free, warm, chocolate-chip cookies available at the front desk never hurt anyone's mood either. :-) I will say the wireless Internet could be faster, but my needs are probably more demanding than most people's. But the rooms were clean and comfortable, especially the beds -- as evinced by my worn-out wife, who took a "nap" at 3pm after the second day and ended up sleeping until 9am the next morning! Great showers, great service overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location next to trolley that can take you anywhere but ...”
Reviews.Author: Rocketsurfer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right next to a trolley stop which can get you anywhere in San Diego. As per the hotel rooms, when I got there they said they didn't have my room, even though I called to tell them to hold my room because I would be checking in late. I didn't take no for an answer and they found me a room. Wasn't a great one because I asked to be in a non-smoking room. The smell from the smoking rooms, which were on the other side of the hotel on the same floor was so bad that I could smell it constantly. Oh well. The staff were pretty nice anyway ...as long as you get your room. The price was average, not a great deal and not too expensive. The beds were comfortable, nothing to write home about. The restaurant staff were friendly and the food was great. Nice pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: ReBroker1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a beautiful decor and fresh rooms which are very pleasant. Overall, the property was very well run. My family utilized the inside and outside pool which were both heated and very comfortable. We parked on the street for three straight nights which saved us $45. There was no issue with finding a street parking spot. There are plenty of restaurants, grocery store, gas stations, etc. A high-end mall is across the freeway with PF Changs and Cheesecake Factory outside the mall. Mission Valley is just a fantastic area. We went to SeaWorld which was 5 miles away and access to the Gaslamp District was easy -- less than 15 minutes. I would agree with a previous reviewer that the room was damp. As we were packing up to leave our clothes felt damp, I guess from the AC unit? Also, they charge a fee for printing in the business center -- Holiday Inn Expresses don't charge for printing so this as kind of annoying. though, a great hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and fresh off a remodel. But a bit damp.”
Reviews.Author: WedPhotog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with the family. The furnishings and decor were very nice. This location was recently remodeled with a warm modern feel featuring dark wood furniture, white bedding, and neutral carpets. Not the typical place you'd bring kids too. There was plenty of parking in the structure. It looked like street parking was a safe option too if you didn't want to pay. We spent a lot of time at the pool which the kids loved. The water was a bit warm though and felt like bathwater. It made getting in and out easy. The one drawback I noticed was the room felt more humid than the hallways and we couldn't bring it down. It was almost uncomfortable to a point that I would leave the door cracked open for a while. To counter, I ran the AC at like 65 degrees during the night. Seems like they need to improve ventilation or something. The coin-op laundry room was very handy for week-long travelers. There is one washer and one dryer so you might need to wait your turn.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the Hilton afilliation fool you...”
Reviews.Author: Marinite38
Reviews.Content: ...this Doubltree did NOT live up to expectations. Starting with the maid service and ending with the hotel's unpreparedness for power outages, this hotel was a big disappointment with guest services and comfort. Maid service is very slow, shoddy and confrontational. Yes, a maid had the audacity to make me--the paying guest--wrong for expecting my room to be cleaned and made up by 4p, despite having left my room at 9a; I was gone for almost 7 hours, but when I returned at 3:30p, my room hadn't been touched. This happened on 2 consecutive days. The second time, I contacted a maid who was servicing a room down the hall from mine and inquired if she knew why my room wasn't done. She was custom-service oriented and immediately got on her radio to ask the maid in charge of my room to clean it. This helpful maid then proceeded to admit to me that my maid forgot to clean my room, however, when my maid showed up less than 2 minutes later, she proceeded to justify her actions as to why she'd skipped over my room (apologizing in-between excuses), making me the bad guy for not calling hospitality to request immediate maid service upon leaving my room at 9a. I explained to her that I thought being gone over 6 hours was plenty of time to assure a tidy room upon my return but this maid kept putting it back on me. This is not proper hospitality! Especially for a guest who is paying $138 a night. Secondly, she and whoever cleaned my room when I checked in the first day either needs a good pair of glasses or they just have not developed attention to detail: upon entering my room for the first time, I found hairs in the bathtub drain and hairs around the toilet. I'll just leave it at that, but it would be interesting to hear what that maid has as an excuse as to why she didn't clean the bathroom floor or the tub. Justify that! The biggest faux pas this Doubletree committed was losing its Internet connection--for 2 days. As a business traveler, this was unacceptable. Calling the front desk yielded an answer that tipped me off that this hotel is not prepared for power outages or brown outs. It seems that with the extremely humid and hot weather San Diego was experiencing while I was there (90% humidity & 93 degrees), a brownout had occurred that knocked the hotel off the Internet and no one could bring it back. I was told by the front desk that if I had an iPhone, I could use that instead. How fortunate for me (not!). Again, poor guest services and a bad (sarcastic) solution for $138 a night. The air conditioning in the hotel was also affected by this brownout. Air conditioning was intermittent the 3.5 days I was a guest. I was on the 9th floor and the hallways, elevators and common areas were suffocating! At one point, my room had no air, but I was able to open the sliding door, though it was hardly fresh: my balcony overlooked the freeway and the open door invited the hot, humid air with the 100+ decibel freeway noise into the room. Only two elevators of the three available worked at any given time. Wait times were average. The rooms have just been redecorated and are very pleasing--contemporary and well-appointed with big screen monitors and a nice selection of channels. The front desk was always courteous and this and the newly decorated rooms are why I am giving the Doubletree Mission Valley a 2. The lady who ran the breakfast room was also courteous and accommodating, otherwise, this hotel would only rate a 1.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Phnxsports
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a four night stay from 6/9-6/12 The best feature is the location. It honestly can not be any better in my opinion. We made it to Sea World, Zoo, Padres game and Mission beach with a quick jump on the trolley across the street and then either one more trolley change or switch to a bus. We made it to all destinations in less then 30 minutes or close to it. The Hazard center is right next door and they have a Joes crab shack, Smashburger, Yogurtland, Applebees, Randy Jones sports bar, Starbucks etc. Denny's and a grocery store are close by as well. We knew the hotel was being worked on and you do notice it between 8:00AM and 8:00PM but we were always up and out of there before it started and got back after they had stopped for the most part. When we did hear it, it wasn’t that bad but maybe loud enough to make it difficult for some to take midday nap. The rooms are fine and the renovations look like they will be awesome. My only complaint is the lack of a mini fridge and microwave. As a family on vacation it would have been nice to bring home leftovers to stretch the dollar a bit more. Hopefully the renovations resolve this along with upgrades to the decor and TV's. Overall, if you are a family on vacation and are looking for a place to stay that is in a quiet area, has a good staff on hand and is convenient for both food and getting around town without having to rent a car, this is the place to go. Do not let the people who are on here nit picking over little things deter you. I will most definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: KarenR49
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel has been recently updated, and it is gorgeous! My husband and I arrived at 4:30pm, but were told our 10th floor executive room was not ready. This was very surprising since check in time was 3Pm. The woman at the desk was very apologetic, and told us she would put a rush on it and comp'd us drinks and appetizers at the Windows lounge while we waited. The bartender, quickly brought us our drinks and delicious chicken quesadillas while we lounged in the comfortable bar area waiting for our call. The call never came, so 40 minutes later, I walked back up to the desk and was told our room was indeed ready. Hot cookies were given at this time. Again, the desk personnel was very apologetic for the wait. Okay, by this time, we are really tired. I was really surprised at the updated, modern decor of our room. One of my pet peeves is bedspreads in hotels. I normally toss them in a corner, the minute I walk in, but I was relieved that the bed was made up entirely in white sheets. The room was immaculate and obviously just redecorated. There was a 40" flat screen in the room and HBO was one of the free channels. Bathroom and closets had frosted glass shoji screens instead of doors, which made them look much larger. There were plenty of towels, folded very pretty. Jar of mints in the room. Walk out balcony. I easily hooked up to Wifi, but the charge was $12 a day, a bit pricey. I received a call from the desk about a hour after settling in telling me that they were going to comp us the cost of parking to again apologize for our having to wait. About 1/2 hour later, we got a knock on the door, and it was a maid handing out hot cookies... Honestly, by that time, I was really tired and that seemed like an intrusion, but I took the gesture as it was given, but I would suggest to management to just skip that part and give them as check out thank you's. Easy check out and found out they had comp'd my internet also. There was construction going on, but we never heard a thing. This was a last minute decision and we found this hotel for $109 a night on Priceline. Fantastic value for our money and I would definitely stay again, but would give them a call an hour before arriving to insure my room was ready....or maybe not. I did get a lot of freebies for 50 minutes of inconvenience!

Reviews.Title: “over priced for the room”
Reviews.Author: goodgirlost
Reviews.Content: April 2009-(i had to chose a date but this is the real day i went 2009) The hotel is lovely, clean, big but the tv was out dated..downstairs at the bar you have big flat screen tv hanging from the wall and in your room is the old school tvs...i guess that would be my only complain is the tv...you have an indoor pool which is a great thing, plently of towels at all times...so i would not stay again but it was nice

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Rennovations NEED additional improvements”
Reviews.Author: hleighaz
Reviews.Content: Doubletree certainly does NOT deliver at this property. I checked in and received a newly rennovated room. Room #1005. The Shower Curtain rod was not securely fastened and hanging loosely. The shower spicket was only partially affixed, and the black out curtains let plenty of light in. They are doing construction and painting at this property, and they failed to inform guests prior to arrival. I was trying to have conference calls and LOUD noises kept interrupting my call. The executive lounge was nothing special. Oatmeal and Eggs for breakfast. Not an impressive selection compared to other doubletrees. Restaurant Happy Hour is a good deal. Avoid the calamari. Front desk staff excel at mediocracy. The staff that I encountered did not seem interested in exceeding or even meeting expectations. Customer Service training would be beneficial in this particular area. Parking is shared with the shopping center, but charged $15 a night. I was disappointed in this hotel considering the rennovations and image sprucing they were working on obtaining. They certainly fell short in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Hitcher84
Reviews.Content: Nothing really special about the hotel. The bed was very comfortable I guess. Rooms were spacious, but the furnishings were a little old. Parking is expensive, and costs extra. As does the internet. Service was average to below average. The staff was nice, but they seemed to be understaffed our whole trip. Waiting to check in, waiting to get something up to our room, waiting for service at breakfast. The breakfast buffet is pretty good, but costs extra. There is nothing really in the area of the hotel of note. The trolley stop is right across the street though.

Reviews.Title: “Everything amazing EXCEPT the room itself”
Reviews.Author: Droppinloads
Reviews.Content: Location is awsome, nice area close to a fancy mall and 100 ft from a sports bar. Building is beautiful , staff is super nice. Lobby, hotel bar, fitness room, and two pools are gorgeous. Now that bad part. The rooms themselves are old. This hotel has got to b less than 10 yrs old, but the rooms look A LOT older than that. Ripped carpet, peeled wallpaper, scuffed/stained furniture, tube style tv, slow drains in bathroom, mold. There are posters in the lobby and flyers in the room announcing a remodel is coming very soon. You can tell any room maintenance is probably put off in preparation for the remodel. These rooms should have been remodeled YEARS ago. Do yourself a favor wait for the remodel of rooms THEN book here. I will stay again, prob this December.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the free cookies - Everything else will cost you”
Reviews.Author: kanling
Reviews.Content: For the last couple of years, I have been staying in mostly business-oriented hotels such as the Hilton Garden Inn. I have gotten used to the amenities that those type of hotels offer that are all included with the cost of the room. Staying at the "full-service" Doubletree San Diego Mission Valley, I was shocked. $1.25 for a local call, $15 for parking, $11.95 for 24 hours of internet, $5 for a bottle of water in the room... are they kidding?! I have also gotten used to having a refrigerator and a microwave in the room - but there are none in the Doubletree. The rooms at the Doubletree are large and clean. I can't call them outdated, but the carpet and furnishings are all of clashing colors and patterns that makes the room look like a second-rate casino hotel. The hotel is just starting a process to remodel, so that should change soon. The bed linens and towels were very nice. I did not use the pool or fitness areas. I am sure that these are significantly better than found in business-oriented hotels. I also didn't need the concierge or the valet parking, I didn't go to the full service restaurant. I don't need the shops off the lobby. If those are more important than internet and parking, then the Doubletree will be ok. The hotel is located in an area populated by chain restaurants and big box stores such as Target and Best Buy. Some restaurants and businesses are within walking distance. There is a San Diego MTS Trolley station right in front of the hotel. (Some rooms get noise from the trolley road crossing gate.)

Reviews.Title: “So Welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: LovTaTravelNY
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Diego late at night after a horrible flight from New York. The staff at the front desk were so welcoming...we even were given warm chocolate chip cookies! We stayed a week. The room was spacious and clean. We worked out in the gym almost every morning. There were treadmills, bikes, elliptical machines, free weights, medicine balls, bosu, mats.etc. We never had to wait for a machine. Most times, we had the gym all to ourselves. We were given complimentary breakfast passes.
