We had breakfast in the restaurant every morning and the selection is nice - the breakfast buffet is good value if you're hungry. There is a small indoor pool and a larger outdoor pool, though we didn't use either. They looked nice, however. We did use the coin laundry, which was handy for anyone on a longer trip who doesn't want to pay hotel laundry rates or carry bags of clothes out of the hotel to a public laundry. The hotel is located directly opposite a trolley stop, which was handy for going downtown, and the Fashion Valley shopping mall is one stop down. Overall this was an okay experience and for the price of hotels in San Diego, relatively good value.

Reviews.Title: “Probably a nice hotel -- if they honor your reservation”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler033
Reviews.Content: We'd booked the room two months ago through their own website and received a confirmation e-mail a week before. None of that mattered. They overbooked, didn't have a room for us (but did check in the people behind us), and sent us to a hotel a 20-minute drive out of town. No room service, no indoor pool, tiny room with only one bed and a rollaway for our son that barely fit in the entryway, blocking the bathroom door. We were exhausted and it was awful. Doubletree is probably lovely, but you can't count on them honoring your reservation. Or even treating you well when they bump you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lovely friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: norwichguys
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Mission Valley is a great hotel in a really good location for a short break in San Diego. The staff are very friendly and the hotel is clean, tidy and comfortable throughout. The location is very good being a short walk/drive from various malls/eateries and other facilities as well as being right on the tram system into town. It is also not far to drive into the centre of SD or especially to the zoo and other attractions in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sudha_8
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. Beautiful big room on the 11th floor, free breakfast and evening canapes in the 11th floor private lounge, fresh baked cookies every day and right by the Hazard trolley stop. Join the Hilton Honours club before you go and get upgraded to the 11th floor. Only 15 mins on the trolley to the centre of San Diego. We didn't need a car at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dv9mrsm
Reviews.Content: We were in California on vacation for a week. We spent the first half in San Francisco and the second in San Diego. We really liked this hotel. Their shuttle will come and pick you up from the airport for free(you will have to pay for the shuttle to take you back but it's cheaper than a taxi). The staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was nice and clean. It was just me and my husband and we ended up with a room with two double beds. I didn't think that was what we booked through hotels.com but we end up with more space so that was fine. The trolley stop is directly across the street. For most of our trip the ticket machine at the trolley station was not taking dollars but you can buy all day passes at the hotel front desk. We did not rent a car and did not need to. We could get everywhere we wanted to go via the trolley. When we went to Mission Beach, we just transfered to the bus at Old Town. (You can also do that to get to Sea World). I read some post that said the hotel is far from downtown but with the trolley being right there it didn't seem that far. A few stops and you're at GasLamp or Petco. So if you don't mind waiting sometimes for the trolley to come,it is still public transportation, you can stay at this hotel without renting a car. We had a great time and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Best Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Simopel
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a 4 day Get-Away Trip on the Memorial Day Weekend. The staff was outstanding friendly, gave tips and information what to do without even asking, the reception hall is pleasent and bright. The room size is absolutely perfect and has modern interior. The bathroom was small comparing to the rest of the room but still okay. We've got every day new shower gel or body lotion if it was used the day before. They provide even special Facial Soap and a face cloth from Neutrogena, which is a good - not cheap brand. Everything was clean and the hotel was very quiet. (At least the time we stayed there) They have an inside and an outside pool, nice bar and restaurant. The breakfast buffet was comprehensive and fresh. The Location is very central and has a perfect connection to several highways. Easy short trip to Sea World, Downtown, Old Town, Balboa Park etc. It is sourrounded by several huge shopping malls and restaurants. Trolley Station across the street. Parking cost extra but there is alos plenty on street parking available. I would recommend this Hotel to everyone and Yes I would defenetly stay there again. Unfortunately we did not have nice weather at our stay but especially than I was glad to have a comfortable nice clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable, new looking, but street noise a problem”
Reviews.Author: Ariz0nian
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Doubletree Hotel San Diego-Mission Valley and enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel is located on somewhat of a dead end street in a very nice, upscale neighborhood. The San Diego trolley has a station stop just across the street making it very easy to get around town. Also, there are two large shopping centers within walking distance with many very fine restaurants. The hotel is very well maintained and looks almost new. However, I feel the check in and check out process would be much better served with more than one desk clerk on duty. The one clerk was very busy with telephone calls and complicated requests which forced me to wait longer than I feel is acceptable to check in and check out. Our room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. However, the noise from the adjacent freeway and highway is a significant problem. At first I thought the sliding door had been left open (it wasn’t). This would be a problem for light sleepers or people sensitive to background noise. I will most definitely return to the Doubletree San Diego-Mission Valley when our travel plans call for us to be in the San Diego area. I feel the hotel was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “$14 per day for self-parking!”
Reviews.Author: seadaughter
Reviews.Content: I would describe the hotel a standard hotel with standard amenities. We received warm cookies on arrival but they were way too sweet and did not make up for the sticker shock of $14 per day for self-parking . We are talking about a place outside the heart of San Diego next to the highway ... (And I am used to all kinds of expensive parking ... coming from Manhattan ... The fee just seems unjustifiable for this part of the country/town ...) The room was spacious and looked nice. However, everything felt like it is made of cheap material. Our room on the fourth floor was also quite noisy. The door was not very sound-proof and I heard people coming in and out for much of the late night/early morning. And then there was this out-of-control party in the hotel that led to police blocking off the entrance for a while ... That was beyond the hotel's control, of course. It just did not add up to a good impression ...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our girls' weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: lucky121721
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the whole experience. Of course there were positives & negatives just like any other hotel, but overall very satisfied! Positives: directly across the street from trolley station (paid $12 for a three day pass that got us unltd trolley & bus and we went all over), located in a nice quiet area, incredibly friendly and helpful staff (really made you feel like they cared about you & we felt very safe traveling; as a group of girls that meant a lot), great breakfast and evening reception for executive level guests (totally worth springing for), spacious room, very comfortable beds, free shuttle pick-up from airport, free wireless internet Negatives: not enough outlets in the bathroom/coffee counter area (had to use an extension cord), no hot water the first day (but was fixed quickly enough when we called the desk), cost is $10 to ride shuttle back to airport (cheaper if there are 4 to split a cab--and they actually got us a towncar for the same price), no fan in the bathroom, not very many towels/ no towel hooks/rack (we hung ours in the closet but housekeeping came quickly when called for more) The negatives are really pretty trifling. We had a great time & plan on going back! FYI: trolley only runs to about 12:45a so if you're out later a cab will cost you about $20-25 from Gaslamp Quarter or Pacific Beach (we loved PB for the college-age low-cover charge Typhoon bar & the awesome Thai restaurant on Garnet--ask to sit on the floor)

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 5 Days for Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: mkgice
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. We wanted to stay at a nice hotel with a few amenities like a spa, restaurant, etc. We arrived early so were not upset when our room wasn't ready. They gave us warm cookies and we waited in the lobby. The room was pretty standard but very clean and professional. The bed was huge and very comfortable with tons of pillows. The hotel offers room service, and for breakfast all you have to do is fill out a checklist of what you want and hang it on the door--very handy and totally delicious! The spa--as far as we could tell--was a small room near the indoor pool. We both got wonderful massages for a very reasonable price. The outdoor pool is much better than the hotel's website photos show. It is modern and minimalist and they have bonfires at night.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the staff at the Doubletree Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: DianeAustralia
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 15 (including 7 young children) who stayed here for 4 nights. Although the hotel is a little tired and the bathrooms are in need of refurbishment, the staff made our stay so enjoyable. I would especially like to pay tribute to Kirk on the front desk. What a delightful young man. We all had a wonderful time and the staff were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality but Freeway Facing Room was Noisy”
Reviews.Author: OregonTravelbug
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights stay while touring USD with our college bound daughter. I prefer to stay at four star hotels where available. After much web searching, reading reviews, etc, I decided not to stay downtown (not in the partying stage of life now!) due to noise and bars. For me all areas of San Diego are a short drive so I was not limited on where in San Diego to stay. All of the upper end hotels were a similar price range unless you jump to the five star level so the costs were similar. Most charge for parking. This Double Tree had $12/day posted on their garage ($15 for valet parking) but we were not charged anything. The staff was very professional and accommodating: we arrived early and a room was not reay but they offered us a temporary room until ours was available. We declined since we were going right out and they gladly tagged and held our carry on bags for us. We were told our room would be prepared next and they called us within an hour and advised us that our room was ready - this was at 11am! My only objection was the freeway was right outside our window and the howling car hum kept me up at night. However be advised that we live on a country road where it is drop dead silent, so we are probably more sensitive to this factor than most. We would most definitely stay at this hotel again if our daugher chooses USD for her undergrad college. I have not stayed at a Double Tree Hotel prior to this visit but I was pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but Expected a lot more for my money”
Reviews.Author: UkZob
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable and I cannot fault the helpfulness of the staff. However I had stayed the previous week at the OMNI hotel in LA and for the 200 pounds per week more that I paid I was expecting a lot more for my money. The lobby is nicely decorated but i found the room a bit dark and the bathroom did not have a separate shower cubicle. The rooms seemed as if they wanted updating. I just could not put my finger on it. Also I think the hotel washes the carpets regularly and there is sometimes a smell of wet dog in the mornings. However the valet parking is reasonably priced and ther is a tram stop just outside the hotel which is great for getting down town and to the malls. A couple of minor complaints: Bar Prices expensive Breakfast prices expensive And only 1 washing machine and 1 dryer for the whole hotel!!!!! what's that about? Overall an OK hotel and I would recommend it to someone who wishes to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: berbicianmaryland
Reviews.Content: Myself husband and 16yr old son stayed at the Double tree Hotel in Misson Valley San Diego for Spring Break. From the time I checked in at the front desk the staff was extremely helpful accomodating and very friendly. Our room was not ready and we were promptly called when it was. The service was top-notch. Everytime I called for something to be brought to the room it was very prompt and I always received a call to find out if what I asked for was delivered. I would highly recommend this hotel and we defenitely will return to San Diego and stay here. KUDOS TO THE STAFF AT THIS DOUBLE TREE EXCELLENT SERVICE !!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Doubletree San Diego Mission Valley”
Reviews.Author: ReadNut
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 day stay at the Doubletree Mission Valley. The staff was the nicest, most helpful, even fun, of any hotel we have ever stayed in - the front desk, the maid service and the wait staff at breakfast. Our daughter and our sister-in-law brought their dogs. There were dog treats for them and of course, their famous chocolate chip cookies for us. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The air conditioning was broken. Maintenance responded almost immediately. It could not be repaired, so they offered to move us - too much trouble, so we were given free breakfasts. All in all, one of our most pleasant stays ever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: neilwilson44
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at the Doubletree and was in no way disappointed. The room good and the bed extremely comfortable. The bathroom like the rest of the room was clean and spacious. The room had a small balcony and it was nice to wake up in a morning and step out as the sun was coming up, while drinking that first coffee of the day. The hotel is in an excellent location, and downtown San Diego can easily be reached by car or by using the excellent tram system. The staff were very friendly and professional and did an all round good job.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jcatral14
Reviews.Content: I needed a nice clean hotel and this place delivered beyond what was expected. I would def go back to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great in all aspects, if you can stand the traffic noice”
Reviews.Author: Panboy
Reviews.Content: Great service, clean and comfortable rooms, conveniently close to the mall and tram stop. All is fine except from at least two heavily trafficed interstates in the near proximity causing a lot of noice. If you don't mind that, there is nothing that can dissapoint you here. Also mind that there is no way you walk from here to the city, you have to bring car or take the tram. But I believe that is reflected in the rate.

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Go Wrong Here!”
Reviews.Author: cujo31
Reviews.Content: From start to finish this was a great experience. The front desk staff was friendly and quick to answer questions. The bed was super comfortable and the room equally comfortable. They give you some extra little bath amenities including special facial cleanser and moisturizer - maybe not a big deal but a nice extra. The waitress (I think her name was Pauline) in the lounge was second to none. Even with a large (and loud) Chargers crowd during the playoff game - she was gracious. She even remembered our drink order when we went there a second night. Food and drink very reasonably priced but there are other options within walking distance. Across the street from the hotel is the trolley which will take you to shopping one stop in either direction or into San Diego with transfer options. I don't think a car would be required if you are here for a couple of days. You can call the hotel from the baggage area at the airport and they will send a free shuttle for you. When you need to return to the airport you need a reservation for the shuttle which leaves the hotel on the hour - there is a small fee of $5.00 for the return trip. For the price they charge, you simply can't go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday”
Reviews.Author: td507
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to the executive floor upon check in, I believe everybody was. I had a vehicle , but had I not there is a trolley directly across from the hotel. The bed was very comfortable with nightly turn down service and a cookie. The restaurant Windows has excellent fries, and has a pleasant atmosphere with notable employees. The outside pool was heated, the exercise room was well equipped. There is a grocery store within walking distance and many quick eat places in the area. They had a holiday buffet with a good selection, I did not participate so I can not comment on the food quality. but it was busy on Christmas day. Enjoy the stay.

Reviews.Title: “GReaT HOTEL!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chivoloco1
Reviews.Content: great location, great hotel, friendly employees. next time in san diego i would stay again. great chocolate cookies. if somebody need and advice, contact. me, i speak spanish

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Access to Transportation”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMom1122
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree to attend a football game at Qualcomm. We we're in San Diego for two nights and never moved the car! The trolley is just too convenient. With a trolley stop literally right outside the hotel door, we used the trolley to get to the Harbor area, Old Town, the football game and a movie. The staff at the hotel was friendly and professional. Our room was spacious, well maintained and the bed was comfortable. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: steve_b2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree Mission Valley for the second time during a business trip, and I can confirm the impression of most part of the other reviewers: - The hotel is conveniently located close to a trolley stop: my wife accompanied me and could not use the car, but she had the opportunity to move by, visiting Old Town and Downtown, in a fast and cheap way, without any need to take a taxi. She could also manage to reach the new "Las Americas" outlet shop center at San Ysidro and enjoy a crazy shopping full-day! Downtown hotels may be more comfortable from this point of view, but they are usually more expensive when compared to the hotel overall quality, while in other San Diego areas you definitely need a car to go anywhere. - OK, the surroundings may be not the loveliest place in San Diego, but the same applies to all other hotels in Mission Valley and Hotel Circle, just overlooking the Interstate 8. The noise coming from the nearby freeway is perceptible only if you have a room facing the freeway itself (which we do), but this was not a real issue for us as we live in town. - The overall hotel experience was quite good: large and clean rooms, rich breakfast, friendly staff, amenities (gym, heated pool, business center) available.

Reviews.Title: “All this and cookies too?!”
Reviews.Author: pennygreen
Reviews.Content: Great stay! Wonderful staff and great facilities! The room was huge and comfortable! We had the Thanksgiving Day buffett in the lobby cafe and it was amazing! Great food!! And they gave us warm, fresh cookies! The parking was a bit expensive, but we managed to find free parking on the street just in front of the hotel. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jon160
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in December 2006, and we came back for another stay over Thanksgiving weekend 2007. If anything, it has improved. The quality of the staff is excellent. The people at the front desk, the bell stand and the valet parking seemed truly interested in our being happy, not just in doing their job. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: carlv247
Reviews.Content: Booked a reward stay on the HHonors program after reading all the glowing reviews about this Doubletree and we were not disappointed. Very convenient for Balboa Park, Sea World and for experiencing a little bit of suburbia. The hotel staff is very pleasant and helpful, the rooms are nice (though obviously upgraded from what could have been a low end Ramada or motel) and the beds comfortable. Overall maintenance of the elevators could have been better, but that was really the only sore point. Nearby are all your conveniences if you're on a business trip: two supermarkets, Jamba Juice, Starbucks, post office, several restaurants (though we drove into the city for dinner at the fabulous Bertrand at Mister A's) etc. Seaworld is closeby, and so are many other attractions. Parking is not a problem here. OK, you don't get a San Diego Bay view, but everything else is here so you save money by skipping the view. The manager's reception on the executive level and breakfast in the morning are very well done and attended by a very helpful and friendly hostess who will give you directions, tips for what to do in the city and more. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Normal business hotel, very inconveniently located”
Reviews.Author: remarks57
Reviews.Content: Because there is not much wrong with the Doubletree in Mission Valley, it ends up getting a very high ranking in San Diego. That's deceptive: in no way is the Mission Valley Doubletree the fifth best hotel in San Diego. Disadvantages: - Location. As others have noted, the hotel is surrounded by highways. It is also surrounded by big box stores and strip malls. Because it is neither downtown nor in a residential area, there are almost no sidewalks and it isn't a great area to walk around at night. I noticed some people call this hotel convenient because it is on the trolley line. The trolley itself isn't terribly convenient--it's really far better to stay downtown, or near the water. - Parking: the Doubletree is next to a HUGE parking lot, half of which is totally free (associated with shopping mall). The $12/fee is leveed on the honors system, which means that you'll feel dishonest if you don't pay, and like a sucker if you do. - no in-room fridge. This is a must for business hotels. Even much less expensive properties have in-room fridges for leftovers and drinks. - Location. Think of the city or town you live in. Would you recommend that tourists stay 20 minutes out of town in the shopping mall district, or near some of your city's greatest attractions like the gaslamp district, zoo, or surfing beaches? We were there for a conference , but ran into other guests who were on vacation and upset that they were miles from the water. And for conference-goers, be advised that going for drinks downtown with friends is much harder if they're downtown and your closest entertainment is Applebees. Advantages: nice pools and gym. Clean room, well serviced.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. The location is great as there is a trolley stop right across the street from the hotel. There are also lots of dining options close to the hotel ( Prego, Applebees, Joe's crab Shack etc) or it is really easy on the trolley to get to downtown or Old Town. We had an executive room on the 10th floor which was really comfortable, large, had an alarm clock which you could plug your Ipod into and a super balcony. Each night we had warm cookies delivered to our rooms which is a lovely touch. The service from all hotel staff was great and the breakfast in the mornings which is free of charge if you're in an exec level room, is excellent. In the evening you can sit outdoors by the fire pits with a drink or sit in the whirlpool. There is an indoor and outdoor pool open until 10pm and a shop in the hotel which also servesStarbucks coffee. Definite place to stay in San Diego and so easy to get into downtown or Old Town in the day or evening.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: eek_19
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The room was comfortable and very quiet. We got cookies on checkin, as well as the following night just because we were in the elevator with the staff member with a cart full of them. The location is very convenient - right by the trolley stop, so we could easily get anywhere on the route, without having to stay right downtown and deal with the noise. Comfortable beds, free internet terminals, helpful staff, a free shuttle from the airport - an all around nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel with Good Service but beware the traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: runningpie
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel in terms of service and amenities are all deservedly high. We were satisfied with all of that - in fact the service was so good that the manager comped our room! Why? Because my wife could not sleep due to the traffic noise. Although this hotel is very conveniently located as everyone says - a 10 minute drive to seaworld without bothering to get on a freeway for example - it is surrounded by busy roads and right next to a shopping center. It is not in any of the pretty coastal areas you might be considering. I guess you have to weigh your options. This property - and Doubletree in general - offers superior service and comfort, but this location is not for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: engnsnow
Reviews.Content: Warm cookies and a backpack full of goodies for my 3 year old when we walked in. Parking is 15 valet or 12 self park. Nice fitness center, sauna and 2 pools. Great service. Very nice at night by the pools and fire pits. Would like to have breakfast buffet included and more free TV channels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: MonsterPl
Reviews.Content: Great location, trolley station across the street, helpful and very nice staff (thank you Martin!), comfortable and clean rooms, nice pool, delicious food and...cookies that you get when you check-in. I recommend it to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Great Area”
Reviews.Author: KrissyH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in August. We loved being able to catch the trolley from across the street. $5.00 for all day. It took us to PETCO Park, the Gaslamp District and Old Town. The staff were great. They gave us another cookie on our second night. Because we belong to Hilton Honors, I asked for a complementary breakfast voucher and received a free breakfast w/drink for my husband and myself. A savings of $30.00! There is a small shopping center adjacent to the hotel and the trolley will take you to Mission Valley and Fashion Valley Malls. Easy access to all major (163, 5, 15, 8) freeways. We will definately stay here again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kaywinnit
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference at a nearby hotel, and I am so thankful I got a room here. The hotel was convenient to grocery stores, restaurants, a movie theatre, and the trolley. Shopping was only one trolley stop away. The room was lovely, and the housekeeping staff did a great job all week. The pocket door for the bathroom is a bit weird, though. The fitness room and pools were nice. I had a breakfast buffet included in my rate, and it was delicious. My only disappointment is they changed the breakfast two days before I checked out and it went from an excellent buffet to eggs and sausage or bacon served at the table. Overall, it was a great place to call home for a week with comfy beds, friendly staff, and a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: CA_mom2
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a couple of days and it was a really nice hotel. Loved the 2 different pools and spa was nice too. The room was clean and staff was friendly. There's nothing I can complain about, would recommend it and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Awaits at this Doubletree Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ten78cop
Reviews.Content: All the reviews about this hotel are true. Service is great. After our first night of sleeping on perhaps the worst hotel mattress ever (serious center sag) I complained to the front desk. By 2pm a new mattress was put in the room! Room is good sized. Bathroom lay out is poor. Not enough counter space. Toilet is under some of the narrow counter so keep the lid closed if you don't want to loose things! Shower water pressure is outstanding. Everything about the room was clean. The room was non-smoking but there was still a slight odor of smoke when you first walked in. The hotel has smoking floors every other floor. Did not use the restaurants/bar at hotel. Pool areas and gym are nice. The location of this hotel is great. Across the street is the trolley which can put you almost anywhere you need to go. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Fashion Valley Mall one trolley stop away or a 5 minute commute by car for even more choices. Posted sign said $12 per day parking fee. During check in I was not asked if I had a car to park (even though I did). Upon check out I was not charged any parking fee. I was glad about that considering the price I paid for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Double tree - San Diego Hazard Center”
Reviews.Author: midottie
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was at the Hazard Center. Beautiful rooms, beds, pool -- fire pits that are lit everynight near the pool, cocktail area. We did not have a car, and used the public transportation Trolley, and bus all weekend, and easily got from this hotel to Old Town for great Mexican atmosphere, , the Harbor for the Harbor tour and to visit the USS Midway floating museum, Gaslamp area, San Ysidro/Tijuana border ( I wanted to see the border-town), and a bus that traversed the whole Island of Cornado, and let us off by the beautiful del Coronado hotel. Total transportation costs for 2 days: $18.00 for 2 people!! We chose to take a cab to the airport, but a bus would have gotten us there too. From this hotels 2nd floor, you are just steps from Kinkos, Trophy sports restaurant, Joe's Crab shack, and Applebees., Starbucks, etc. and We got a wonderful buy on Hotwire to boot! My husband really enjoyed seeing all the Navy vessels in the harbor, the training center for the Navy Seals, etc. This is one great town. Got to see Petco park, and three more stopsy past our hotel would have gotten us to Qualcomm Stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Exeptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Luckymommy
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (including kids aged 9 and 4) had a delightful stay at this hotel. We found the customer service to be exemplary! We were always addressed by our names, and every encounter we had with the staff involved them bending over backwards to make our stay pleasant. For example, we had requested extra bath towels from housekeeping one evening. Not only were the towels promptly delivered, we also received a call from the front desk to make sure the towels had arrived and to make sure we were satisfied. This happened more than once, as we made various basic requests. The room was a good size and comfortably accommodated our family. The hotel itself is lovely--clean and well-maintained. I would definitely consider staying at this hotel again. I consider myself to be fairly picky, and the Doubletree Mission Valley did not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay iin San Diego”
Reviews.Author: atrainsmom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to sunny California. We were gone for a total of 10 days. Spent 5 days in Santa Barbara (where we have been to before) and spent the remaining 5 days in San Diego. We were VERY PLEASED with the Doubletree in Mission Valley. Pros: Location is great. We did all of the sights in San Diego and everything in the city was only about a 10-15 minute drive. (It is only actually a few miles from downtown.. but w/ California traffic; it is about a 10-15 minute drive) The hotel is also right across the street from the Trolley; which we did take advantage of the first night we were there. We took the trolley to seaport village. It is definitely worth taking for the experience.. especially if you have young children..they will love it! One caveat though.. make sure you have small bills to purchase the tickets from the self serve machines. We only had a $20 and my husband had to run back to the hotel to get change because the ticket machine only gives up to a few dollars in change. AND... you don't need to buy your child a ticket unless he/she is 6 or over. We went to Legoland (twice) and that was about 25 minutes away. The Wild Animal Park was also about 20 to 25 minutes away. The room was very clean. Hotel amenities were great. There are 2 pools..one indoor and one outdoor. My family and I were out and about all day so we didn't get to use the outdoor pool, which closed at 10 pm..but the indoor pool is open 24 hours which was nice and we did go for a late night swim at 11 pm. :o) There are firepits outside next to the outdoor pool, which looked very nice to sit next to. There are also lighted tennis courts at the hotel. The fitness room was under renovation when we were there; but they were offering passes to the YMCA which was located right next door. The pictures of the "new" fitness center look very nice! Check In and Check out were very easy. The concierge and bell staff were very friendly. Cons: I really don't have any.. :o) If I get back to San Diego again I would definitely stay at the Doubletree again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaCJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from another trip to San Diego. We found the Doubletree on Hotwire and couldn't resist the price. I would have paid 5 times as much for such a great hotel. The staff was freindly and courteous like I have never seen before, the room was spacious enough and very clean, the beds were super comfortable. Parking did cost $12.00, but we're talking about covered parking in a garage under the hotel not out on the street. You don't even need a car here, there is a trolley station right across the street and an all day pass cosy only $5.00 per person, try finding gas that cheap! We had only one problem, a dog left alone in a room across the hall while the owners went out was barking, a call to the front desk sent security right away and the problem was resolved in less than 5 minutes. The room was very quiet, you might want to ask for one on the side away from the freeway. We were on the side near the trolley tracks and could barely hear it when they came by. We stay in San Diego a lot and usually wind up at a different hotel each time because we are looking for the best deal, however, I think in the future we will just start looking right here for our hotel everytime. I give this place 5 stars, 6 if you'll let me.

Reviews.Title: “very clean”
Reviews.Author: maris05
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean and spacious, beds were very comfortable, bathroom excelent. Negative points: althought my room was not at the freeway side, I had a lot of constant noise from some "machine" outside the hotel. No fridge in the room. The breakfast was not worth the value. In general, the employees at the front desk were nice, except the lady at my check in, very rude. The location in not great for those who don´t have a car. Far from downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NODAK1979
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Hotwire, and got it for 85 dollars...which was a steal. I really don't have any complaints about the hotel....the room was ample, check-in was a breeze, and it's in a great location to just about everything you'd want to see. Parking was 12 dollars, but it's more at comparable hotels, so you really can't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Robyn80
Reviews.Content: I held two events here and the event staff and my stay was great! The hotel is convenient to the Old Town Area, downtown San Diego and the Zoo. The bellstaff (particularly Lindsay and Nate) were great. I got sick and Nate drove me to a walk in clinic. I was referred to by name at the front desk and loved everything about my stay. My room overlooked the freeway and I had no problems with noise. I recommend this hotel to all San Diego visitors!

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: CaKazmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed over May 12th. I did have to pay for parking $12, because at registration they asked me if I drove. I did use the pools and gym, and they were adequate. I felt the hotel was very safe, clean and close to everything I needed. Being with just my daughter, these issues were important. The beds are great. My biggest complaint would be the bathroom...it was too small. Plus it had a sliding door, that could barely close. Not what I expected for $180 a night. And my view was of a rooftop! Not the best considering you are in San Dieog. But, I would probably stay again, if it was just me and my daughter.

Reviews.Title: “WOW what a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bunky67
Reviews.Content: Boy I am shocked this hotel hasn't gotten better reviews of 5! We were supposed to move to another hotel after a few days as we were in San Diego with my husband on business. The weekend was supposed to be spent at the Embassy Suites Downtown (see my review of it! YIKES!) but after seeing what it was like we came right back to the Doubletree Mission Valley! We were so happy to be there! My husband is a rewards member and we stayed on the 11th floor and had our bfasts included! It was wonderful! Lea at the executive level lounge serves a great bfast! And was so nice! All the staff at this hotel went above and beyond for us! The ONLY complaint I have is that, as stated in a earlier review there is street noise. This would be something doubletree should fix in the future. They remodel every 2 yrs we were told. So hopefully they will sound proof a bit better. But the decor and comfy beds were wonderful! I have no complaints. This hotel was very very clean! And there are 2 pools for the kids and a nice hot tub! There are several restaurants nearby, applebees, Trophys (great food), asian food and italian restaurant Prego, also a Quiznos sub place....very nicely situated with all walking distance! OH also there is a food 4 less walking distance from the hotel too! The mall is just the next trolley stop from the hotel and the trolley stops across the street from the hotel. The hotel was not overrun with people and was very nice and quiet most of the time! The walls are not very well insulated I don't think....we did have a issue one night hearing our neighbors on the other side making a bit too much noise for our kids ears! But the hotel took care of that quickly. It was nice! We had a great trip! And if we go to San Diego again we will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Ick”
Reviews.Author: DawnNoelm
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my 10 year old daughter. We were in town for a cheer competition at San Diego State. I would NOT recommend this hotel. The rooms greatly need a re-do as do the hallways. Our room smelled like a dog - literally. The noise from the freeway kept us both awake.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal stay”
Reviews.Author: Tizmania
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree Mission Valley for 5 nights right after New Years with my wife and 4 year old son. We stayed on a Hilton Honors floor, which definitely felt exclusive. It was high up, and had some of the most comfortable beds I've ever experienced in a hotel. The hotel is very centrally located - Mission Valley is within a 15 minute drive to downtown, Coronado, the Zoo and Balboa Park, and La Jolla. It is definitely in the land of shopping, which can be taken or left depending on your tastes. There is a Cheesecake Cafe and PF Chang's near by to eat at - these places always please. The pools were lovely, as was the hot tub. Staff was friendly, and we felt safe at all times. Breakfast in the executive lounge on the top floor is HIGHLY recommended,and made us feel very special. There is TECHNICALLY a $12 daily charge to park, but at the recommendation of Trip Advisor reviews, we just parked and took a chance. We had no issues, and saved $60 - nothing to sneeze about! My only complaint about this hotel is the lack of a free business centre to use the Internet. I had to go outside the hotel to a nearby Kinkos. Now THAT is cheesy. Other than that, I would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Mall hotel. Average and not cheap.”
Reviews.Author: sac-eats
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel three times for business and each stay gets a little worse. The "neighborhood" is basically a large big box retailer center, which comes in handy if you forget to bring a belt, but does not really give you much of a taste of beautiful San Diego. The hotel staff was really friendly and helpful, and I cannot fault them, but there are a few complaints. Although the hotel has a nice indoor pool, the rest of the workout facility is outdated and some of the equipment was out of order. Also, the traffic noise, not just from the freeway but also from the trolley, was readily apparent whenever I went to sleep. That, and the towels were abrasive enough to rub the skin off a porcupine.

Reviews.Title: “Another fine doubletree property”
Reviews.Author: fjnovak1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is available cheap on Priceline (consistently $60 or even less). Its close to restaurants and grocery stores, parking is charged for but there is street parking available also.... The fitness room is great, the pool is tremendous, beds comfy, five stars all around!!! I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fit the bill. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: orchidboy
Reviews.Content: Based upon the reviews on tripadvisor we bookd two nights over x-mas. parking was a snap [i was charged for it]. check-in was a brezze and the hot cookies a nice touch. room was fine and the bed was comfy. the only negative was getting on the internet in our room. i had to go to the lobby. they took it off the bill. the food was pretty good for a hotel. if you really want a great meal check out Hash House A-go-go. it is a five minute drive. food is great, only negative is the size of the portions -- they are too big. first meal i can recall not finishing. the zoo and wild animal park are easy to get to from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Soooo good!”
Reviews.Author: usawannabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights from 1st December 06. Arrived early but immediately checked in, warm chocolate chip cookies at chec-in, superb room, most comfortable beds, complimentary Nutrimetic bathroom products, guest laundry, location could not be topped for 2 women reliant on public transport and shopping options! Plus very helpful and knowledgable concierge. Not a single negative.... hmmm, perhaps one! Hotel shuttle driver we paid to take us to the airport clearly found it too difficult to put our bags on the kerb for us as opposed to him grunting at us as he left them on the road... more upsetting is that I habitually tipped him and that's what most annoys me! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Doubletree Mission Valley”
Reviews.Author: Daylami
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights from 25 November. We went down to San Diego after having spent four nights at the Doubletree Guest Suites in Santa Monica. The hotel in Santa Monica was great, so we were looking forward to staying in this hotel, and we were not disappointed. We had booked an executive room (these are on floors10 and 11 and you need your key card to access these floors from the lift). Our room was very nice, clean and comfortable. The Doubletree beds are VERY comfortable. The bathroom has complimentary toiletries. Guests in executive rooms get complimentary continental breakfast on the 11th floor, which includes choice of juice, cereals, toast, bagels, boiled eggs, fresh fruit, pastries, cakes, tea and coffee. The hotel is conveniently located right by a trolley stop. A trip into downtown San Diego takes about 30 minutes. The Fashion Valley mall is one stop away on the trolley. We bought a three day pass for the trolley (which can also be used on buses) which was great value. We were in San Diego to go to the Charger vs. Raiders football game and the trolley goes from outside the hotel right to the stadium in only 10 minutes or so. We had a great stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Run Far and Run Fast!”
Reviews.Author: cabogolf19
Reviews.Content: This place is bad, bad, bad. It is extremely overpriced for what you get. I had an 8th floor room facing Interstate 8. Good luck getting any sleep. Shame on you Doubletree, how can you justify charging top dollar for a room on the freeway side? You should provide earplugs for guests that are subjected to this horrendous noise. In addition, apparently their restaurant never got the word that there was an issue with serving fresh spinach. I completely lost my desire to finish my meal. When this was pointed out to the server, the cost of the meal was removed from my bill. The service in the bar was extremely poor. There is no other choice for dinner. You may want to eat elsewhere or face going hungry. Overall this experience doesn’t even deserve to rate below average. If you don’t need to stay here don’t. A host of other better and less expensive lodging choices abound in San Diego. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. I will next time.

Reviews.Title: “liked the doubletree”
Reviews.Author: anon03
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week while attending a business conference at the hotel. Our 11th floor room was very spacious with comfortable beds and high quality linens. The room seemed to be well soundproofed, which is very important to us. We are very picky about not hearing noise from neighboring rooms. Housekeeping was excellent. We had a bit of traffic noise, though only a very minor inconvenience. but our room faced the pool --I think rooms facing the numerous freeways around the hotel might have more of a traffic noise problem. The only problem we had was the inescapable piped-in music at both pools and the hot tub, and some rowdy teenagers who rudely interrupted my lap swimming. Otherwise, we had a great experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: wessa
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel centrally located. Very clean. Friendly staff. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “clean, modern and super location”
Reviews.Author: pradancer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here August 27th. I am already booking reservations to come back in November for Thanksgiving Shopping!!!! "Clint" at the Front desk was excellent! It was CLEAN!!!! The grounds were Clean and modern. The Entry and valet area did not have concrete, but granite sidewalks, automatic doors, and everything you would expect from a luxury hotel. Some areas of the hotel reminded me of the Ritz Carlton. It was just that clean, well kept and impressive. The Bed was big and super comfortable. The room was large and spacious! The Swimming pools were super fun. The hot tub was the smallest I have ever seen-but hey, it is great the hotel has a large indoor pool. The Fitness room was Clean and large. There is an outdoor fireplace at night. The shopping area is FANTASTIC! The hotel is surrounded by upscale malls, shopping centers and every store and food court you can imagine. There is a Neiman and Saks! The beach is a nine minute drive. The hotel is not too far from Sea World, but you of course, you need a car. Only complaints: (1) Not enough Cable channels. No Disney channel for our kids. (2) The hot cookies have nuts and oats inside. (3) The old man at the concierge must be a volunteer. He was old and impatient and unprofessional. No more Marriott for me, I got hooked at the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “Not overly impressed”
Reviews.Author: Aussie08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree for three nights at the end of July. We called ahead the day before to tell them we would be a late check in due to late flights. On arrival we were told there was no room for us and the hotel was fully booked. As soon as my husband produced proof of the phone call a room was miraculously found. We are still not sure if it was a scam or not. The room itself was adequate with the exception of there being no fridge. Unlike Alaska, San diego is a warm climate and we couldn't believe there was no fridge. There is also no safe. Housekeeping was bearly average with occasionally hair left behind in the bathroom. We would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: billberry
Reviews.Content: Me and the Mrs stayed there July 17, 18 and enjoyed the place alot. The rooms were nice and clean, the people staff was super friendly and happy to tell us all about SD. At night by the pools they light fires in a lave pit and folks come down and chat over a few cold ones and have something to eat as well. Parking was 12 bucks a night like they say even if the gate is up at the parking garage but everything is so close as far as food goes so it was all good. We bid 75 bucks on price line and that was a great rate since most of the rooms were going for 200+.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: menher
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for several nights, some of which were paid for with Hilton Honors points, and the remainder at near $200 per night. Ours was a standard room, nonsmoking, with a king-size bed, a small balcony, and nicely located in the hotel. The room was quite comfortable and well appointed, including two phones with internet ports and the usual array of toiletries. The hotel has convenient access to two interstates and a metro "trolley" that runs frequently to many areas of interest, yet it is sufficiently insulated from most traffic noise. There are a number of restaurants and small shops in the Hazard Center next door, and other shopping and so forth within easy walking distance. Our dissatisfactions were these: (1) The hotel has a Fountain Cafe, its only dining facility, that is described as being open at all three usual mealtimes, but in fact has not been open for dinner for some months, according to two employees. They said this is due to the availability of several good restaurants nearby. The full Fountain menu was reportedly available in the lounge; we tried it once and the food was well below average. We never saw more than three occupied tables in the Cafe for breakfast, so we decided to eat that meal elsewhere as well. (2) The plumbing noises from the adjacent room were quite loud, and obviously came from each one of the fixtures as it was used. When we complained to the front desk, we were told that no other room was available. (3) Parking in the covered garage costs $12 per day, and there is a disclaimer of responsibility that includes no guarantee that the garage will be monitored. Indeed, we never saw anyone resembling a security person. The access gate was always in the open position, and so no key card was issued to guests who paid for this service. (4) There is a small "concierge" desk just inside the lobby doors. One of the staff there was borderline rude when we asked for advice and directions. Most of the employees, however, were quite cordial and helpful. We understand that Hilton Honors has recently increased by quite a lot the number of points required to stay here. We probably won't take them up on it in the future.

HotelInfo.Name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel San Diego - Mission Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 7450 Hazard Center Drive, San Diego, CA 92108
